skill.name: modal
skill.description: Run Python code in the cloud with serverless containers, GPUs, and autoscaling. Use when deploying ML models, running batch processing jobs, scheduling compute-intensive tasks, or serving APIs that require GPU acceleration or dynamic scaling.
skill.summary: Run Python code in the cloud with serverless containers, GPUs, and autoscaling. Use when deploying M...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing no executable code. All 566 static findings are false positives - the scanner misinterpreted markdown documentation examples as executable code. The skill contains only Markdown files explaining how to use the Modal cloud platform, with no Python files, scripts, or actual command execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Deploy Python to cloud with GPUs and autoscaling
content.value_statement: Running ML models and batch processing locally is slow and expensive. Modal lets you deploy Python functions to the cloud with automatic GPU access, containers that scale from zero to thousands, and pay-only-for-compute billing.
actual_capabilities: Deploy Python functions to serverless cloud containers with GPU support
Scale automatically from zero to thousands of parallel containers
Run scheduled cron jobs for periodic data processing and model retraining
Persist data across runs using distributed volumes for model weights and datasets
Securely manage API keys and credentials through Modal Secrets
Serve HTTP endpoints and APIs with automatic HTTPS and custom domains
limitations: Requires Modal account and authentication token for cloud access
Cloud resources incur costs based on compute usage beyond free credits
Limited to Python workloads; other languages require custom Docker images
Cold starts may cause latency on first request after idle periods

use_cases.title: Deploy ML model inference
use_cases.description: Serve transformer models and custom ML models with GPU acceleration and automatic scaling

use_cases.title: Run batch data processing
use_cases.description: Process large datasets in parallel across hundreds of containers without managing infrastructure

use_cases.title: Schedule compute jobs
use_cases.description: Automate periodic tasks like model retraining, data pipelines, and report generation

prompt_templates.title: Basic model deployment
prompt_templates.scenario: Deploy a Python ML model to Modal
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me deploy a Hugging Face transformer model to Modal for inference. I want to use an L40S GPU and serve predictions via a web endpoint.

prompt_templates.title: Batch processing
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Modal script that processes 1000 CSV files in parallel across multiple containers using .map(). Each file needs CPU and memory resources.

prompt_templates.title: Scheduled training
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a weekly scheduled job on Modal that retrains my model on new data every Sunday at 2 AM UTC. Include GPU access and checkpoint saving to a Volume.

prompt_templates.title: Web API with secrets
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a Modal web endpoint that uses FastAPI, requires bearer token authentication, and accesses external APIs using Modal Secrets for credentials.

output_examples.input: Deploy a sentiment analysis model to Modal with GPU
output: Create Modal App with custom image (debian_slim with torch and transformers)
Define GPU configuration (L40S for cost-effective inference)
Build class-based service with @modal.enter() for model loading

output_examples.input: Process 500 files in parallel with Modal
output: Define image with pandas and numpy for data processing
Create process_file function with CPU and memory parameters
Use .map() to distribute 500 files across containers
Configure max_containers for parallel execution limits
Aggregate results from all parallel runs

output_examples.input: Set up a daily scheduled job for data pipeline
prompt: Create Modal App with required dependencies
Add Volume mount for input and output data
Deploy with modal deploy for production scheduling

best_practices: Pin package versions in image definitions for reproducible builds
Use Volumes to store model weights and avoid re-downloading on each run
Configure min_containers to reduce cold start latency for production APIs
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys in code instead of using Modal Secrets
Processing items one-by-one instead of using .map() for parallel execution
Forgetting to call volume.commit() after writing data that needs to persist

faq.question: Is Modal free to use?
faq.answer: Modal offers $30/month in free credits for new accounts. Pay only for compute used beyond that.

faq.question: What GPU types are available?
faq.answer: T4, L4, A10, A100 (40GB/80GB), L40S, H100, H200, and B200. L40S offers best value for inference.

faq.question: How does Modal integrate with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Install the Modal skill, then write Python functions decorated with @app.function() to run code remotely.

faq.question: Is my data safe on Modal?
faq.answer: Modal encrypts data at rest and in transit. Secrets are encrypted and not logged.

faq.question: Why am I getting timeout errors?
faq.answer: Default function timeout is 5 minutes. Increase with @app.function(timeout=3600) for longer operations.

faq.question: How does Modal compare to AWS Lambda?
faq.answer: Modal offers better GPU support, longer timeouts (up to 24 hours), and persistent storage via Volumes.
